thread.title: What time will polling stations for the EU referendum close?
thread.title_full: What time will polling stations for the EU referendum close?

author: Keiran Southern
title: What time will polling stations for the EU referendum close?
text:
What time will polling stations for the EU referendum close? 12:57, 23 Jun 2016 Thousands of voters across the North East will be making their way to the ballot box to have their say on the historic decision Shares Get daily news by email Polling stations open across the region for the EU referendum 
Thousands of voters across the North East will be making their way to polling stations to have their say on the EU referendum . 
Experts are saying the result will be too close to call, even after a gruelling 10-week campaign. 
Prime Minister David Cameron is backing Remain, while Boris Johnson is the Brexit camp’s highest profile politician. 
Polling stations in the North East opened their doors at 7am on Thursday, but what time do they close? What time do the polls shut? 
Polls will shut at 10pm. Is this the same for other election? 
Yes. Elections in the UK always allow the same amount of time for people to cast their vote. Polling stations open across the region for the EU referendum How do I know what polling station to visit? 
The location of your polling station will be written on your polling card. 
If you’ve lost it, don’t worry. You can find out where you have to go by contacting your local election office, or using our guide. 
Also read: Where are the polling stations in the North East for the EU referendum? When is the result? 
Experts say the soonest we will know is around 6am or 7am on Friday, but we could have indications of the result sooner than that. 
Although there are no official exit polls, some private companies will be doing them, and then using their knowledge to gamble on the outcome. 
This could give an early indication of the result. What is the question on the ballot paper? 
“Should the United Kingdom remain a member of the European Union or leave the European Union?” 
You then place a cross in the box of your choice.
